description.narrative:
To collate the formative research (LAC (7 countries), Tunisia, Zimbabwe, and Nigeria) <(>&<)> baseline study (Solomon Islands) on social norms to create a multi-country/ regional technical paper with overarching analysis on SN trends.
The aim of the research is: i. to provide an overview of the present social norms in countries a, b, and c that perpetuate VAWG and ii. understand their mechanisms of existence (e.g. social sanctions, underlying gender norms) and iii. show how the Enough Campaign in countrya, b, and c is trying to counter these social norms iv. Provide overarching analysis of the findings and what is could mean for other work on social norms
This all, in order to contribute to understanding of social norms that perpetuate VAWG. We willaim for a technical paper for professional practitioners in the area of VAWG and/or social norms and donors who have a technical remit.
Furthermore, the paper can be useful to update Oxfam staff and partners about research on social norms and increasethe awareness of the Enough Campaign.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib was founded in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Oxfam Novib is member of the Oxfam International confederation. Working together in the confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education for all, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam Novib's main office is based in The Netherlands, it supports the work of a network of local offices, the implementation of global projects, fundraising, campaigning and advocacy. Oxfam Novib’s the Hague office contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

description.narrative: Shifted norms and attitudes: # of citizens (M/F), including people living in poverty and injustice, consider a life free from violence a fundamental right for men and women.
role models / frontrunners expressing their views during events / on platforms organized by Oxfam and partners
Shifted norms and attitudes: # of citizens (M/F), including people living in poverty and injustice, consider a life free from violence a fundamental right for men and women.
men, including people living in poverty and injustice, consider a life free from violence a fundamental right for men and women.
women, including people living in poverty and injustice, consider a life free from violence a fundamental right for men and women.
